intro: Datisca, commonly known as the horse-radish plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Capparaceae. It consists of several species, with Datisca glomerata being the most well-known. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Datisca is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
